eTag.Description: eTag of the resource. To handle concurrent update scenario, this field will be used to determine whether the user is updating the latest version or not.

schedule.Description: The schedule associated with the export.

format.Description: The format of the export being delivered. Currently only 'Csv' is supported.

deliveryInfo.Description: The delivery information associated with a export.

runHistory.Description: Result of listing the execution history of an export.

partitionData.Description: If set to true, exported data will be partitioned by size and placed in a blob directory together with a manifest file. Note: this option is currently available only for modern commerce scopes.

nextRunTimeEstimate.Description: If the export has an active schedule, provides an estimate of the next execution time.

status.Description: The status of the export's schedule. If 'Inactive', the export's schedule is paused.

recurrencePeriod.Description: The start and end date for recurrence schedule.

destination.Description: This represents the blob storage account location where exports of costs will be delivered. There are two ways to configure the destination. The approach recommended for most customers is to specify the resourceId of the storage account. This requires a one-time registration of the account's subscription with the Microsoft.CostManagementExports resource provider in order to give Azure Cost Management services access to the storage. When creating an export in the Azure portal this registration is performed automatically but API users may need to register the subscription explicitly (for more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-manager-supported-services ). Another way to configure the destination is available ONLY to Partners with a Microsoft Partner Agreement plan who are global admins of their billing account. These Partners, instead of specifying the resourceId of a storage account, can specify the storage account name along with a SAS token for the account. This allows exports of costs to a storage account in any tenant. The SAS token should be created for the blob service with Service/Container/Object resource types and with Read/Write/Delete/List/Add/Create permissions (for more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cost-management-billing/costs/export-cost-data-storage-account-sas-key ).

resourceId.Description: The resource id of the storage account where exports will be delivered. This is not required if a sasToken and storageAccount are specified.

container.Description: The name of the container where exports will be uploaded. If the container does not exist it will be created.

rootFolderPath.Description: The name of the directory where exports will be uploaded.

sasToken.Description: A SAS token for the storage account. For a restricted set of Azure customers this together with storageAccount can be specified instead of resourceId. Note: the value returned by the API for this property will always be obfuscated. Returning this same obfuscated value will not result in the SAS token being updated. To update this value a new SAS token must be specified.

storageAccount.Description: The storage account where exports will be uploaded. For a restricted set of Azure customers this together with sasToken can be specified instead of resourceId.

type.Description: The type of the export. Note that 'Usage' is equivalent to 'ActualCost' and is applicable to exports that do not yet provide data for charges or amortization for service reservations.

timeframe.Description: The time frame for pulling data for the export. If custom, then a specific time period must be provided.

timePeriod.Description: The date range for data in the export. This should only be specified with timeFrame set to 'Custom'. The maximum date range is 3 months.

dataSet.Description: The definition for data in the export.

from.Description: The start date for export data.

to.Description: The end date for export data.

granularity.Description: The granularity of rows in the export. Currently only 'Daily' is supported.

configuration.Description: The export dataset configuration. Allows columns to be selected for the export. If not provided then the export will include all available columns.

columns.Description: Array of column names to be included in the export. If not provided then the export will include all available columns. The available columns can vary by customer channel (see examples).

properties.Description: The properties of the export execution.

eTag.Description: eTag of the resource. To handle concurrent update scenario, this field will be used to determine whether the user is updating the latest version or not.

executionType.Description: The type of the export execution.

status.Description: The last known status of the export execution.

submittedBy.Description: The identifier for the entity that executed the export. For OnDemand executions it is the user email. For scheduled executions it is 'System'.

submittedTime.Description: The time when export was queued to be executed.

processingStartTime.Description: The time when export was picked up to be executed.

processingEndTime.Description: The time when the export execution finished.

fileName.Description: The name of the exported file.

runSettings.Description: The common properties of the export.

format.Description: The format of the export being delivered. Currently only 'Csv' is supported.

deliveryInfo.Description: The delivery information associated with a export.

runHistory.Description: Result of listing the execution history of an export.

partitionData.Description: If set to true, exported data will be partitioned by size and placed in a blob directory together with a manifest file. Note: this option is currently available only for modern commerce scopes.

nextRunTimeEstimate.Description: If the export has an active schedule, provides an estimate of the next execution time.

message.Description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

eTag.Description: eTag of the resource. To handle concurrent update scenario, this field will be used to determine whether the user is updating the latest version or not.

displayName.Description: User input name of the view. Required.

scope.Description: Cost Management scope to save the view on. This includes 'subscriptions/{subscriptionId}' for subscription scope, 'subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}' for resourceGroup scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}' for Billing Account scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/departments/{departmentId}' for Department scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/enrollmentAccounts/{enrollmentAccountId}' for EnrollmentAccount scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/billingProfiles/{billingProfileId}' for BillingProfile scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Billing/billingAccounts/{billingAccountId}/invoiceSections/{invoiceSectionId}' for InvoiceSection scope, 'providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/{managementGroupId}' for Management Group scope, '/providers/Microsoft.CostManagement/externalBillingAccounts/{externalBillingAccountName}' for ExternalBillingAccount scope, and '/providers/Microsoft.CostManagement/externalSubscriptions/{externalSubscriptionName}' for ExternalSubscription scope.

createdOn.Description: Date the user created this view.

modifiedOn.Description: Date when the user last modified this view.

dateRange.Description: Date range of the current view.

query.Description: The definition of a report config.

chart.Description: Chart type of the main view in Cost Analysis. Required.

metric.Description: Metric to use when displaying costs.

kpis.Description: List of KPIs to show in Cost Analysis UI.

pivots.Description: Configuration of 3 sub-views in the Cost Analysis UI.

type.Description: The type of the report. Usage represents actual usage, forecast represents forecasted data and UsageAndForecast represents both usage and forecasted data. Actual usage and forecasted data can be differentiated based on dates.

timeframe.Description: The time frame for pulling data for the report. If custom, then a specific time period must be provided.

timePeriod.Description: The start and end date for pulling data for the report.

dataset.Description: The definition of data present in the report.

includeMonetaryCommitment.Description: If true, report includes monetary commitment.

from.Description: The start date to pull data from.

to.Description: The end date to pull data to.

granularity.Description: The granularity of rows in the report.

configuration.Description: The configuration of dataset in the report.

aggregation.Description: Dictionary of aggregation expression to use in the report. The key of each item in the dictionary is the alias for the aggregated column. Report can have up to 2 aggregation clauses.

grouping.Description: Array of group by expression to use in the report. Report can have up to 2 group by clauses.

sorting.Description: Array of order by expression to use in the report.

filter.Description: The filter expression to be used in the report.

columns.Description: Array of column names to be included in the report. Any valid report column name is allowed. If not provided, then report includes all columns.

name.Description: The name of the column to aggregate.

function.Description: The name of the aggregation function to use.

type.Description: The type of the column in the report.

name.Description: The name of the column to group. This version supports subscription lowest possible grain.
The name of the column to sort.

and.Description: The logical "AND" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

or.Description: The logical "OR" expression. Must have at least 2 items.

not.Description: The filter expression to be used in the report.

dimension.Description: The comparison expression to be used in the report.

tag.Description: The comparison expression to be used in the report.

name.Description: The name of the column to use in comparison.

operator.Description: The operator to use for comparison.

values.Description: Array of values to use for comparison

id.Description: ID of resource related to metric (budget).

enabled.Description: show the KPI in the UI?

type.Description: Data type to show in view.

name.Description: Data field to show in view.
